column4: could someone please explain to me how to search a folder on an xp machine over a network by filetype?
how do you search?
i have been using the search button :|
perhaps that is not the right way to search?
if you "mounted" it using the "Places > Connect to a server" it should be in ~/.gvfs
you could also just type 'mount' in the terminal and see where it is mounted
i mounted them to a folder in /home
rolie: that would probably be my issue, then
if it IS mounted, it should appear when you run mount with no params
it appears, but as rolie just mentioned the search feature doesn't seem to support wildcards
rolie: so how do i search for all files of a type?
rolie: that seems a bit cumbersome to, for example, display all mp4s in a folder
in nautilus you could add a filter to the results. click on the plus and you'll have a file type selection. just select "Videos"
rolie: i guess i've been locked into windows too long- failing to see the obvious, simple solution. searching mp3 gave exactly what i was after
rolie: i kinda feel silly now:-/
no need to feel silly :) in the file type selection you have other as well with a list of specific types.
